text:
Q: How to Target .net Framework 7.0 in Visual Studio 2022? A:

launch the visual studio installer first, download the SDK you need such as dotnet 7, it goes back all the way to dotnet 6 as we speak on Dec of 2025.

When you finished installed do the following.

move your project from onedrive / desktop synced location to a root C:\project or some storage location where Microsft onedrive does not mess with with, system folder protection will give you hard time.

Re-Open your legacy project make sure you open the .SLN project file extension, do not manually modify any configurations.

now look at solution explorer your project-> Analyzers: inspect every nuget package that you got make sure there is no warnings nor errors in order to have a successful compilation.

if all errors still there, this indicates whatever dotnet target those packages were built for is either not installed, or it even could be blocked by enterprise policy if this is professional dev env.

I hope this helps.

another solution is try docker, it's little extra leg work, but it saves you from installing legacy risky framework on your system.

Q: store latitude and longitude in ios address book A:

In iPhone native address book it's not possible to store. But you can do one thing, you can store info of the user in SQLite database in your app along with lat lon and if you want some synchronization functionality then you can create a web service which will update your SQLite database as per your logic.

Q: Switch user not working when connected to MySQL 8 database A:

i finally found the bug. i cannot believe what caused the 404 not found issue.it was a single line in the configuration file.

before the application.yml looked like this

---
grails:
    profile: web
    codegen:
        defaultPackage: rcroadraceweb4
    gorm:
        reactor:
            # Whether to translate GORM events into Reactor events
            # Disabled by default for performance reasons
            events: false
info:
    app:
        name: '@info.app.name@'
        version: '@info.app.version@'
        grailsVersion: '@info.app.grailsVersion@'
spring:
    jmx:
        unique-names: true
    main:
        banner-mode: "off"
    groovy:
        template:
            check-template-location: false
    devtools:
        restart:
            additional-exclude:
                - '*.gsp'
                - '**/*.gsp'
                - '*.gson'
                - '**/*.gson'
                - 'logback.groovy'
                - '*.properties'
management:
    endpoints:
        enabled-by-default: false


server:
    servlet:
        context-path: '/roadrace'


---

hibernate:
    cache:
        queries: false
        use_second_level_cache: false
        use_query_cache: false


grails:
    plugin:
        databasemigration:
            updateOnStart: true
            updateOnStartFileName: changelog.groovy

    controllers:
        upload:
            maxFileSize: 2000000
            maxRequestSize: 2000000

    mail:
        host: "localhost"
        port: 25
        default:
            to: 'root@localhost'
            from: 'noreply@runnercard.com'

dataSource:
    type: com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
    pooled: true
    driverClassName: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver
    dialect: org.hibernate.dialect.MySQL8Dialect
    dbCreate: none
    properties:
        minimumIdle: 5
        maximumPoolSize: 10
        poolName: main-db
        cachePrepStmts: true
        prepStmtCacheSize: 250
        prepStmtCacheSqlLimit: 2048
        useServerPrepStmts: true
        useLocalSessionState: true
        rewriteBatchedStatements: true
        cacheResultSetMetadata: true
        cacheServerConfiguration: true
        elideSetAutoCommits: true
        maintainTimeStats: false
dataSources:
    logging:
        # This is not used unless `useJdbcAccessLogger` or `useJdbcLogger` is set to `true`
        # This does not need to be setup unless it is in use.
        type: com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
        pooled: true
        driverClassName: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver
        properties:
            minimumIdle: 2
            maximumPoolSize: 5
            poolName: logging-db
            cachePrepStmts: true
            prepStmtCacheSize: 250
            prepStmtCacheSqlLimit: 2048
            useServerPrepStmts: true
            useLocalSessionState: true
            rewriteBatchedStatements: true
            cacheResultSetMetadata: true
            cacheServerConfiguration: true
            elideSetAutoCommits: true
            maintainTimeStats: false

environments:
    development:
        dataSource:
            dbCreate: none
            url: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3307/dev2?useUnicode=yes&characterEncoding=UTF-8
            username: root
            password: password
        grails:
#            mail:
#                host: "smtp.gmail.com"
#                port: 465
#                username: "justforstackoverflow123@gmail.com"
#                password: "1asdfqwef1"
#                props:
#                    "mail.smtp.auth": "true"
#                    "mail.smtp.socketFactory.port": "465"
#                    "mail.smtp.socketFactory.class": "javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory"
#                    "mail.smtp.socketFactory.fallback": "false"

    test:
        dataSource:
#            dialect: org.hibernate.dialect.MySQL5InnoDBDialect
            dbCreate: none
            url: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3307/test?useUnicode=yes&characterEncoding=UTF-8
            username: root
            password: password


    production:
---
logging:
    level:
        root: INFO
        org.springframework: WARN
        grails.plugin.springsecurity.web.access.intercept.AnnotationFilterInvocationDefinition: ERROR
        grails.plugins.DefaultGrailsPluginManager: WARN
        org.hibernate: ERROR # TODO: we need to lower this, and fix the warnings this is talking about.
        rcroadraceweb4: DEBUG
        com.runnercard: DEBUG
        liquibase.ext.hibernate.snapshot.HibernateSnapshotGenerator: ERROR

---
#debug: true
#useJdbcSessionStore: true
---
environments:
    nateDeploy:
        behindLoadBalancer: true
        grails:
            insecureServerURL: 'https://nate-dev.nate-palmer.com/roadrace'
            serverURL: 'https://nate-dev.nate-palmer.com/roadrace'
        dataSource:
            url: 'jdbc:mysql://10.1.10.240:3306/rcroadwebDEV?serverTimezone=America/Denver'

it was this line in environments > development block

 #        grails:

it worked after commenting the grails line.

but all the contents of grails block is commented so i am still confused why having grails uncommented would have this big issue. anyways solved after days of hard search!

Q: datetimepicker plugin selects one hour back after selecting particular time A:

See this bug report thread: https://github.com/xdan/datetimepicker/issues/596

datetimepicker seems to depend on an old version of php-date-formatter which seems to have a bug in it.

Easy mitigation:

An easy way to mitigate it is to just add this config parameter to every picker field with a 12-hour time component either in the output or the input:

validateOnBlur: false

Another commenter advised changing to the "moment" formatter but that did not work for me. This however did.

Ideal fix:

The ideal fix is to download a newer version of php-date-formatter. If you use the NPM package, there's a way to tell it to download a newer version of the library and rebuild it, I won't go into that as I'm no NPM expert.

If you downloaded the JS code and are hosting the script yourself, you basically need to delete jquery.datetimepicker.full.min.js, open jquery.datetimepicker.full.js, find the line near the top that starts with this:

 !function(t,e){"function"==typeof define&&define.amd

Replace that whole line with the similar line from this file:

https://github.com/kartik-v/php-date-formatter/blob/master/js/php-date-formatter.min.js

Then also copy it to jquery.datetimepicker.full.min.js and run it through any JS minify script or online tool.

Be sure to Ctrl+F5 any page you were using the script on so your browser actually uses the newly modified JS file rather than the cached version with the bug in it! You may want to load it with date parameters to be sure

Example:

<script src = "js/jquery.datetimepicker.full.min.js?t=2025-12-14" ></script>

Q: Icecream output format align A:

You can use ic.configureOutput and pass a prefix argument that includes a line break. The default prefix is 'ic| ', so maybe 'ic|\n'.

See https://github.com/gruns/icecream?tab=readme-ov-file#configuration.

Q: Unable to resolve host: No address associated with hostname A:

I had the same problem with one of my crypto wallets only to discover my app needed to be updated and once I updated the app everything was smooth from that point on. When I first went to the Play Store to see if I had any updates due, there were none but when I searched specifically for my wallet app in the Play store an update was needed. So make sure you search for the specific app that is giving you the problem in the Play store.

Q: How to fix executor failed running [/bin/sh -c pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall pip==9.0.3 && pip install --upgrade 'setuptools<45']: A:

I had the same issue, the problem was the base image I was using. Once I changed it to a working one the error disappeared. I specifically used a python3.9.10-slim image from our local repo. Once I switched to the regular python3.9.0 image all worked well.

The python3.9.10-slim image being corrupted is a problem in our repo but maybe what you're experiencing is caused by the same type of issue.
